3.heading: Fox, Gill, 1915-
3.title: "Apartment 3-G"
3.author: by Brian Kotzky
notes: Summary: Comments on the strip originated by Alex Kotzky and Nick Dallis in 1961. When Dallis died in 1991, Alex Kotzky took over the writing until he died in 1996. His son Brian then drew the strip, with writer Lisa Trusiani, until 1999, when he resigned and the art went to Frank Bolle. This article introduced by Gill Fox. Includes samples of the strip from various eras.

67.heading: Fox, Jason.

notes: Summary: Jason's bored with the real world, except for chocolate chip cookies.
Key words: Dinosaurs, spaceships, haunted castles, helmets, buckets.

68.heading: Fox, Jason.
68.title: "Gullible Twice?"
68.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Phoebe and Eileen invite Jason and Marcus to go stargazing again now that they have a truce.
Key words: Scaring, fear.

69.heading: Fox, Jason.
69.title: "It's Important to Stretch your Brain Muscles before going Back to School"
69.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Jason is vigorously contemplating negative and positive infinities.

70.title: Fox, Jason. "100 Percent Secret"
70.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: The word ballons are obscured by a tree limb, so we don't know if Jason and Marcus took the oath.
Key words: Fun, girls, boys, clubs, pariahs, outcasts, friends for life.

71.heading: Fox, Jason.
71.title: "Something Very Special In Mind"
71.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: The girls are surprised that Jason and Marcus actually came, after all their pranks, and they plan to thank them for the trust; the boys run away.
Key word: Flashlights, unbelievable.

72.heading: Fox, Jason.
72.title: "The Universe Upside-Down"
72.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Making peace with the girls has left Jason and Marcus afraid that they are becoming tolerable, or even friends.
Key words: Plotting, beating, enemies, canoes.

73.heading: Fox, Jason.
73.title: "Where Do You Get All This Money?"
73.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Jason accepts hush money from his dad, caught sneaking in with an expensive new golf club. Jason is reading a comic book: Jellyfish Man.

179.heading: Fox Feature Syndicate--Articles About.
179.title: "The Bad, the Strange, and the Sleazy! : Jungle Queens and Sexy Teens Made Fox Comics one of the Most Controversial and Collectible Comic Companies of the 1940s!"
179.author: by Michelle Nolan
179.appears_in: p. 13-17 in Comic Book Marketplace, v. 2, no. 52 (Oct. 1997).
notes: (Nolan's Notebook)
Discusses history and publishing of the Fox Features Syndicate. Includes a checklist of Fox comics that might not exist, of Fox title changes, and of the last titles published by the company.
